President BillClintonwonareprieve from the sexual harassment lawsuit against him when a jud ge rule yes- terday that the plaintiff must wait until he leaves office for the trial. But the ruling judge refused to throw out the case and allowed investigators for Paula Jones to continue gathering evidence in the meantime. Clinton is facing allegations from Jones, a former Arkansas state employee, that he made unwanted sexual overtures during a May 1991 conference in a hotel when he was state governor and she was working for the state. Jones filed a suit against Clinton May 6 of this year, two days before the statute of limitations was to have run out.
